intro: Pectis thimiodora, commonly known as the narrowleaf pectis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Pectis thimiodora is often found in grasslands and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
